resource.chars:
Royal Observatory Greenwich 1848 June 19

My dear Sir

I have read Professor C. P. Smyth's
paper entitled "Attempt to apply Instrumental
Measurements to the Zodiacal Light", and have
to report on it as follows.

The author, after graphically describing in 
general terms one well marked instance of 
Zodiacal Light which he had seen in the Cape 
Colony, states that he had applied a rude 
equatoreal instrument to ascertain the Right 
Ascension and Declination of the [open?] of the 
beam, and gives the results of seven such determinations. 
I call attention specially to this 
part because it is the only part that is strictly 
original.

A series of detailed remarks follow, explaining 
when and under what form the Zodiacal light

S. H. Christie [Esq.?]
Sec. Royal Society

489
